meanings.definition: A yearly publication containing a calendar for the coming year, predictions of the times and movements of the sun, moon, and planets, and other astronomical data.
meanings.sent1: My grandma always checks her almanacs to know when the full moon will be.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new almanac to keep track of the moon phases.
meanings.sent3: The almanacs predicted a sunny day, but it rained instead!
meanings.sent4: Her almanacs were like magic books, revealing the secrets of the stars.
meanings.sent5: The almanacs were filled with celestial wonders, making each day special.

meanings.definition: A handbook, typically published annually, containing information of general interest or on a sport or pastime.
meanings.sent1: The almanacs at the library had tips for gardening and cooking.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy reading almanacs about different sports to learn new techniques.
meanings.sent3: He used the almanacs to impress his friends with random facts.
meanings.sent4: The almanacs were a treasure trove of knowledge, like a mini encyclopedia.
meanings.sent5: She carried the almanacs everywhere, finding joy in every page she turned.
